content.en: Enhancing radar algorithms: Researchers have been exploring ways to improve the performance of algorithms used in airborne radar applications. By developing new methodologies and incorporating prior knowledge, these algorithms show potential for better performance in non-Gaussian clutter environments and cases with mismatched clutter and steering statistics. Additionally, algorithms such as the parametric adaptive matched filter and the multistage Wiener filter have been found to outperform traditional methods in detecting targets and mitigating interference.
content.da: Forbedring af radaralgoritmer: Forskere har undersøgt måder at forbedre ydeevnen af algoritmer, der anvendes i luftbårne radarapplikationer. Ved at udvikle nye metoder og inddrage forhåndsviden viser disse algoritmer potentiale for bedre ydeevne i ikke-Gaussiske støjmiljøer og tilfælde med uoverensstemmende støj- og styrestatistikker. Desuden har algoritmer som den parametriske adaptive matched filter og multistadie Wiener filter vist sig at overgå traditionelle metoder i at opdage mål og reducere interferens.
